intro: Clematis stanleyi var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent clematis, is a deciduous vine native to China. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale blue flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
